summary: Brazilian jiu-jitsu is a martial art and sport that teaches self-defense through grappling and ground fighting. It was created by the Gracie family in Brazil, inspired by Japanese judo. BJJ focuses on using leverage to control and submit opponents, proving that smaller people can defeat larger, stronger ones. Practitioners spar, or "roll," to practice techniques in a live setting. BJJ can be practiced with or without a gi (uniform), and it's governed by the International Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu Federation. It's great for fitness, character building, and self-defense.
title: Brazilian jiu-jitsu
